subsc: (Historic)Electric power and other energy adjustment,(Historic)Distribution and transmission

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Fourth Power Project for
            Jamaica were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, project
            sustainability was likely, Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:  where industry
            standards personnel levels are important to the attainment
            of efficiency improvements, as is the case for public
            utilities, a specific loan covenant covering these levels
            should be agreed with the borrower. To help avoid delays in
            the early stage of project implementation, sufficiently
            qualified personnel should be required to be appointed as
            soon as possible and, at the latest, before loan
            effectiveness. If adequate, tariff levels and structure or
            sector policy reforms are necessary, they should be required
            to be implemented before loan effectiveness given the
            difficulties of achieving such reforms subsequently.
